reviews.sentence: Hotel Conditions. My wife and I are Honors members and were very disappointed with this property. When we went to our room in the VILLAS there was mold in the bathroom. Needless to say we immediately went to the front desk and the lady found us room in the TOWER. She was very helpful and understanding. I must say this is a very old hotel and needs MAJOR renovation. The food is outrageously overpriced. The nicest thing about this hotel is the pool and beach area. Hilton should be ashamed to put there name on this property.

Disappointing. very disappointing stay could not wait to check out luckily we were only here for one night prior to our cruise. The staff was excellent the location was great but the rooms were disgusting. As you walk out the elevator you turn into dark halls and worst of all was entering the room. The sliding door handle to the balcony was dangling from the door. All the walls had scrapes and dents and to top it off I had to shower with sandals on because the bathroom had mold. it is a shame because the pool area was pretty decent but they should take some time during the day to give the pool some maintenance there were cups and food spilled in the pool that should have been attended too.

Great Vacation. This hotel is great I would of rated it a 5 but the furniture in the rooms just need to be updated Hair dryer to be checked and replaced with new ones and the bathroom is beautiful with the exception that it should have air vents that blow to keep the bathroom mirrors from fogging even with the door open the glass still fogged up. The Staff were amazing and great customer service. My husband and I stayed in the ocean view room that was awesome could not complain at all. As with any other hotel everything was extremely pricey but that is to be expected at the hotels so make sure that you venture out and go to other places to eat and drink go to Walgrens In Old San Juan buy your liquor there or any Walgrens and bring it back to the hotel room. Yes you pay a cab ride but you will have something to drink for the rest of your stay so its worth the 15 bucks. or take a nice 30 minute walk as my husband did and cab ride home. I would definitely stay again. just hope they update the furniture and bathroom vents. Old San Juan is a 30 minute walk way and worth it or take a cab for about 15 bucks. There is a Denys across for the Condona Hotel The furniture to be updated dresser drawers were loose and would not clothes properly. The hairdryer need to be updated blowing airvents in bathroom.

Overly firm bed ruined the stay. Several years ago another famous hotel brand learned that the 1 feature customers want from a hotel is a comfortable bed thus the Heavenly bed was born. Even though we paid an extra 12 night to be upgraded to a recently renovated room this Hilton hotel fails to recognize this priority. Bed was new but hard as a slab of granite. 5 nights of uncomfortable bed nearly ruined our visit. Good customer service at the front desk and the pool bar but it stopped there. Bartenders and servers at our groups reception were a bunch of grumpy old men. Some of the same negative attitude showed up at the lobby bar. And do not waste your money in the Italian restaurant especially at breakfast. Overall nice place with the above exceptions.

Hilton San Juan. 60 year old outdated hotel that requires a complete makeover considering I build hotels I believe my comments are validexcelent if you want a spring break holiday but for a family not ideal. Expensive and service is sub standard to the hilton hotel standard also safety was alsoa concern as I found numerous security personel all over the hotel one wonders why. Far end of beach was nice Old San Juan town is lovely would stay there next time I visit Rebuild the hotel complete refit got to be a money maker where the owners are fully aware that the can still charge full rates for substandard ser.

Nice hotel outdated rooms close to restaurants. The hotel is nice but the rooms are outdated need cleaning comfortable beds the patio doors were super dirty and hard to open. Hotel it self was nice. Perhaps the updated tower is better. Over all experience of the hotel was good food drinks service was great.

Friendly staff but needs renovation. I love the location the coast friendly staff and the amenities. Location was awesome. 5 10 minutes to Old San Juan and major shopping areas. Rooms need major renovation. If you do not upgrade you are stuck with 1970s decor and stuffy room.

Disappointed. Poor housekeeping and maintenance department. Clean linen not supplied daily. Room not cleaned daily. Requested maintenance repair of bathroom door that would not stay closed. This did not happen. No sheets on bed only a duvet.

The facilities were great. We got off from a cruise and just used the hotel for the day while we were there. We had a great time snorkeling and using the pools with the kids. You can also go visit the fort next door. It was a much needed relaxing day and was very close to the port. The room could use some maintenance but overall we had a great time.

Hotel needs renovations. Beautiful Hotel except for the rooms. Staff was great about moving us to different rooms but Carpets were filthy particularly in the Hilton Honors section. Hotel needs to hire additional cleaning staff and update rooms. Scenery and staff both outstanding. Maintenance hotel is showing its age.

Wonderful experience. This hotel is just beautiful. It ’s in a perfect location the staff is just so friendly and helpful and the rooms where very spacious and new with the remodeling after the hurricane. Staying at Caribe Hilton is the perfect way yo experience everything Puerto Rico has to offer.
Property was recently renovated and it shows. Unfortunately this place is poorly managed and run like a days inn.

First Hilton in the Caribeanmagnificent Resort. This Hotel is completely renewed after Hurricane MARIA my room have a spectacular sea view very elegant and comfortable room a Huge bathroom with amenities. The restaurant is with a vew for pool and Beach. the food exquisite. The people in the hotel very kind. It ’s a tropical paradise I love it.

Renovated Classic Caribe Hilton Birthplace of the Pina Colada. We enjoyed the quiet beach environment and had a great family fun time of the expansive multi tier pool with multiple polside and beach areas for lounging. Centerpiece among the pools is a moderate sized infinity pool overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. The atrium reception desk with fruit infused water along with the connected Caribar restaurant bar for drinks and light bites area accentuate attention to detail at the Caribe Hilton. It reopened after extensive remodeling in May 2019. I recommend Hilton gold status to cover cost of available daily breakfast at onsite restaurant Salitre del Caribe. Daily Pina Colada tasting offered from 1230 to 10 near the pool is also a small notable treat. Given the 40 daily resort fee I took a look at the gym but was not tempted enough to engage. I was impressed with a brief tour of the spa complete with ocean based spa decor and an aromatherapy scent that I wish I could take home. My eye starts to twitch and my hand shakes a bit when I think about 40 resort fees but held it together for my family. I recommend hilton points usage mandated sufficient to pay for the entire stay as a way to have the resort fees excluded. The spa is well designed and decorated. Old San Juan was within reach by 412 Uber ride pick up at the side street for my family of four and Taxis are also available.

Newly renovated hotel close to Old San Juan. The rooms were very spacious with cool bathroom comfortable bed and great balcony. The renovations were recently done after the hurricane so the hotel looks spotless. The beach is great with warm water clean beach and plenty of space. There is a Starbucks around the lobby which is an added bonus for a great morning coffee. Also the lady at the front desk managed to check us in around noon which was very nice of her. Having travelled around the world I would say the hotel pool is rather small for a hotel of this size. However the pool is literally steps from the beach and beach is better than pool so this was not the biggest flaw. For some reason the hotel does not like Ubers to come for pick up which we did not know so we had a small issue on the last day. This should be communicated immediately so there are no unnecessary problems. Other than that this is a great hotel perfect for holiday.

Business trip. Renovated hotel was immaculate staff extremely welcoming. Room had a great view of one of the island ’s three forts. Bartenders were extremely knowledgeable and helped us discover some great rims that we had n’t known about. Location was great and short rides to Old Town and our office.

Excellent experience. Excellent customer service. The staff in the front desk at check in is very friendly and welcoming. The hotel is renovated and beautiful. The views to the Atlantic Ocean are amazing. We really enjoyed our stay.

Renovated hotel staple brand. Overall experience at the hotel with fantastic. The location is great and the staff are very helpful. Getting the best view easily is available in the ocean view wing of the hotel. Almost all rooms of three pretty great view of the ocean. The food in the hotel is also pretty amazing I would recommend a restaurant.

Modern resort great location. The Caribe Hilton is a beautiful property nestled right on the beach. The recent remodel was needed was well done. Everything is updated very clean modern. The staff is outstanding. Many restaurants attractions within easy walking distance. A great destination I will definitely return.

Nice renovation. Rooms were nicely renovated clean and comfortable. Service was good. Meeting rooms were nice but banquet food can greatly improve. Gorgeous view from the balcony. Staff is friendly. Food and beverage prices are too expensive.
